section.title: Solutions Analytic at Three Singularities: Heun Polynomials

para.sentence: Let \alpha=-n , n=0,1,2,\dots , and q_{n,m} , m=0,1,\dots,n , be the eigenvalues of the tridiagonal matrix \begin{bmatrix}0&a\gamma&0&\dots&0\\ P_{1}&-Q_{1}&R_{1}&\dots&0\\ 0&P_{2}&-Q_{2}&&\vdots\\ \vdots&\vdots&&\ddots&R_{n-1}\\ 0&0&\dots&P_{n}&-Q_{n}\end{bmatrix}, where P_{j},Q_{j},R_{j} are again defined as in ยง31.3(i).

Then \mathit{Hp}_{n,m}\left(a,q_{n,m};-n,\beta,\gamma,\delta;z\right)=\mathit{H\! \ell}\left(a,q_{n,m};-n,\beta,\gamma,\delta;z\right) is a polynomial of degree n , and hence a solution of (31.2.1) that is analytic at all three finite singularities 0,1,a.
Some properties are included as special cases of properties given in ยง31.15 below.
